headline.main: SCHENCK DENIES MOVIE MONOPOLY; Loew Head Tells Senate Group Such a Conspiracy Could Never Come to Pass

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) -- Nicholas Schenck, president of Loew's, Inc., which controls Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, told a Senate subcommittee today he would consider it "the worst kind of a crime" for a group of companies to "get together" to prevent another company from doing business.
abstract: Testifies, Sen subcom hearing on moving picture industry
